title: Cluedo Knight
description: A digital adaptation of the classic Cluedo board game, featuring a hollow knight theme and interactive gameplay.
markdown:
## Overview

A **thematic digital reimagining** of the classic Cluedo (Clue) murder mystery board game, set in the haunting underground kingdom of Hallownest from *Hollow Knight*. Built in C++ with Allegro 4, this project transforms the traditional Victorian mansion mystery into an atmospheric pixel-art adventure through the fallen bug civilization, featuring iconic characters, signature weapons, and memorable locations from Team Cherry's beloved Metroidvania.

**Game Concept:** Players navigate Hallownest's interconnected caverns as warriors and wanderers, deducing which character committed murder, with which weapon, and in which location through strategic interrogation and elimination.

## Technical Approach

### Architecture

**Tech Stack:**
- **Language:** C++ with object-oriented design patterns
- **Graphics Engine:** Allegro 4 (2D sprite rendering, event handling)
- **Art Style:** Custom pixel art faithful to Hollow Knight's monochromatic aesthetic
- **Design Paradigm:** OOP architecture separating game logic, rendering, and user input

### Core Systems

**1. Game Logic Engine**

```cpp
// Cluedo game structure adapted to Hallownest
class CluedoGame {
    vector<Character*> suspects;           // 6 Hollow Knight characters
    vector<Weapon*> murderWeapons;         // 6 weapons from the game
    vector<Room*> hallownestLocations;     // 9 map locations
    Solution* secretSolution;              // Hidden answer
    vector<Card*> playerHands;             // Distributed clue cards
    
    void dealCards();
    void processPlayerTurn();
};

class DeductionSystem {
    void suggestSolution(Character*, Weapon*, Room*);
    Card* refuteSuggestion(Player*, Suggestion*);
    bool makeFinalAccusation(Solution*);
};
```

**Mystery Generation:**
- Randomly select 1 character + 1 weapon + 1 location as solution
- Remaining 18 cards distributed among 3-6 players
- Players move between Hallownest areas, make suggestions, eliminate possibilities
- First correct accusation wins; wrong accusation = elimination

**2. Board Movement System**

**Hallownest Navigation:**
- **Graph-based layout:** Locations connected via tunnels/passages (mimicking the game's interconnected map)
- **Dice roll mechanics:** 2D6 determines movement range per turn
- **Secret passages:** Direct connections between distant areas
- **Location entry rules:** Must enter area to make suggestion about that location

**3. AI Opponent System**

**Decision-Making Algorithm:**
- Track all revealed cards across game history
- Probability matrix for unknown cards (Bayesian inference)
- Strategic suggestion generation targeting knowledge gaps
- Defensive refutation logic (show least informative card when possible)

```cpp
class AIPlayer : public Player {
    map<Card*, float> knowledgeBase;
    
    void updateBeliefs(Suggestion, Card* revealed);
    Suggestion generateSuggestion();  // Prioritize high-uncertainty cards
    Card* chooseRefutationCard(vector<Card*> matching);
};
```

**4. Hollow Knight Thematic Integration**

**Visual Design:**
- **Monochromatic palette:** Black/white/grey base (faithful to HK's art style)
- **Selective color accents:** Blue (Soul), orange (infection), teal (Lumaflies)
- **Atmospheric effects:** Particle systems for environmental details
- **Character sprites:** Pixel art with idle/walking animations
- **Location backgrounds:** Hand-painted scenes from Hallownest's areas

**Card Design:**
- 6 characters: Warriors, scholars, and wanderers from the game
- 6 weapons: Iconic blades and tools (Nail, Needle, Club, Longnail, Scythe, Claw)
- 9 locations: Memorable areas from Hallownest's map
- All 21 cards directly reference Hollow Knight lore

**5. UI/UX Design**

**Game Screens:**
- Main menu with Hallownest title card aesthetic
- Player setup (name entry, character selection with portraits)
- Game board view showing map layout
- Detective notebook (checklist grid for eliminating cards)
- Suggestion/accusation dialog boxes
- Victory/defeat screens

**Allegro 4 Rendering Pipeline:**
- Double-buffered rendering for smooth animations
- Sprite sheets for character frames
- Hand-painted location backgrounds (pixel art)
- Custom bitmap font rendering
- Manual memory management (load/unload bitmaps)

### Design Patterns Applied

**Object-Oriented Architecture:**
- **State Pattern:** Game phases (setup, turn sequence, movement, suggestion, accusation)
- **Observer Pattern:** Notify players when cards are revealed
- **Factory Pattern:** Generate and shuffle card deck
- **Strategy Pattern:** Different AI difficulty levels
- **Singleton:** Game instance manager

## Challenges & Solutions

| Challenge | Solution |
|-----------|----------|
| **Adapting mansion layout** to Hallownest | Graph-based board respecting game's interconnected structure while maintaining Cluedo's strategic balance |
| **AI difficulty balancing** | Tunable probability thresholds; AI uses logical deduction without cheating |
| **Allegro 4 memory constraints** | Manual bitmap lifecycle; texture atlases; lazy loading for backgrounds |
| **Information asymmetry** rendering | Layered UI: public board → private hand → investigation notes |
| **Thematic consistency** | Pixel art style guide matching HK's 1-bit + accent color aesthetic |
| **Turn management** (3-6 players) | Event queue system with clear turn indicators and phase announcements |

## Results / Impact

**Gameplay Features:**
- ✅ **Full Cluedo ruleset** implementation (classic board game mechanics)
- ✅ **3-6 player support** (human and AI players)
- ✅ **Atmospheric presentation** faithful to Hollow Knight's melancholic tone
- ✅ **Replayability:** Randomized solutions (216 possible combinations)
- ✅ **Complete game loop:** Setup → investigation → deduction → resolution

**Technical Achievements:**
- Demonstrated mastery of **OOP principles** (inheritance, polymorphism, encapsulation)
- Applied **game AI** techniques (knowledge representation, probabilistic reasoning)
- Gained experience with **2D game development** pipeline (design → art → code → testing)
- Learned **legacy library integration** (Allegro 4's C-style API in modern C++)

**Artistic Contributions:**
- **Custom pixel art:** Character sprites with animations, weapon icons, location backgrounds
- **UI design:** Victorian detective aesthetic merged with Hollow Knight's minimalism
- **Thematic fusion:** Successfully adapted murder mystery to dark fantasy setting

**Learning Outcomes:**
- **Game Design:** Turn-based mechanics, information asymmetry, deduction gameplay
- **Software Architecture:** State machines, event-driven programming, MVC pattern
- **Asset Management:** Sprite sheets, bitmap atlases, font rendering in Allegro 4
- **Algorithm Design:** AI decision trees, probability tracking, graph traversal
- **Creative Adaptation:** Translating existing IP into new gameplay context
